snippet: A few days after Monday’s anniversary of Jackie Robinson’s debut with the Brooklyn Dodgers, Cooperstown, N.Y., will dedicate a street to Bud Fowler, a much earlier player who helped integrate the game.
abstract: Cooperstown, NY, home of Baseball Hall of Fame, will dedicate street to Bud Fowler, who has gone largely unnoticed, despite being first African-American known to have played for white professional baseball team several decades before Jackie Robinson's debut with Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947.
lead_paragraph: A few days after Monday’s anniversary of Jackie Robinson’s debut with the Brooklyn Dodgers, Cooperstown, N.Y., will dedicate a street to Bud Fowler, a much earlier player who helped integrate the game.

headline.seo: Cooperstown to Honor Baseball Pioneer Bud Fowler
headline.main: Acclaim Comes Late for Baseball Pioneer
headline.print_headline: Acclaim Comes Late For Baseball Pioneer
